title: The NBA star that never was - the death of Len Bias
description: Len Bias turned from feel-good story to cautionary tale in the space of two fateful days in 1986. The young basketball player's death set in train two imponderable questions that sparked fascination and fear.

title: Interest rates: Force banks to offer mortgage help, says Labour
description: Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves sets out Labour's response to the crisis facing many mortgage payers.

title: Missing Titanic sub search team expand search area as oxygen fears mount
description: More boats and underwater vehicles will join the search as the US navy helps analyse detected noises.

title: Charity swimmer Iain Hughes missing in English Channel
description: Iain Hughes, 42, has not been seen after starting the swimming challenge on Tuesday.

title: Ilkay Gundogan: Manchester City captain to join Barcelona on free transfer
description: Manchester City captain Ilkay Gundogan will join Barcelona on a free transfer when his contract expires at the end of this month.

title: Isolating sooner might have avoided first lockdown, Hunt says
description: The UK should have prepared to test and isolate more, the ex-health secretary tells the Covid inquiry.

title: Church of England sacks independent abuse panel
description: They were dismissed by a council of senior bishops after two members said their work was obstructed.

title: Russell Martin: Southampton name Swansea City boss as new manager
description: Southampton name Swansea City head coach Russell Martin as their new manager.

title: Royal Ascot 2023 results: Frankie Dettori triumphs on Gregory; Mostahdaf, Jimi Hendrix win
description: Frankie Dettori claims a winner at his final Royal Ascot meeting as he takes the Queen's Vase aboard Gregory.

title: Chris Mason: Rishi Sunak is in a bind over inflation
description: Some in government want to ease impact of inflation but others are exasperated with "knee-jerk" interventions.

title: Titanic sub: Safety concerns raised about missing submersible
description: A former employee warned of potential safety problems with the OceanGate vessel in 2018.

title: The Ashes 2023: England will go 'harder' at Australia - Brendon McCullum
description: Coach Brendon McCullum says England will go "harder" at Australia after their agonising two-wicket defeat in the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston.

title: Labour plans to expand Lords despite abolition pledge
description: The party says new peers created would have to back replacing the chamber with an elected assembly.

title: Snooker match-fixing scandal: Five players have bans increased by Chinese governing body
description: Five players, including Yan Bingtao and Zhao Xintong, have their bans increased by Chinese authorities for their involvement in a match-fixing scandal.

title: Paris explosion: Seven critically injured after blast
description: Sixteen people are injured after an explosion in the capital's fifth arrondissement, police say.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Nurse had favourite way of killing, jury told
description: One of Lucy Letby's favourite ways of harming babies was by injecting air, a prosecutor tells a jury.

title: Queen's 2023 results: Cameron Norrie beats Jordan Thompson to reach quarter-finals
description: British number one Cameron Norrie comes from behind to reach the Queen's quarter-finals for a second time with victory over Jordan Thompson.

title: Amazon accused of tricking Prime customers
description: The US has sued Amazon for allegedly manipulating customers during the Prime sign-up process.

title: Nadia Kalinowska: Minimum 22-year term for stepdad who killed girl
description: Five-year-old Nadia Kalinowska suffered more than 70 injuries including a fractured skull.

title: The Ashes 2023: Women's Test match set for enthralling Trent Bridge opener
description: Australia are a dominant force in women's cricket, but they and England are facing a step into the unknown when the Women's Ashes begins on Thursday.

title: Mason Mount: Chelsea reject second Man Utd bid of £50m for England midfielder
description: Manchester United have had a second bid - worth up to £50m - for England midfielder Mason Mount rejected by Premier League rivals Chelsea.

title: Warning DIY waste charges ban could push up council tax
description: Councils warn getting rid of fees to dispose of DIY material will see costs passed on to households in other ways.

title: The Ashes: Jonny Bairstow's ups and downs in first Test
description: BBC Sport looks at the good and the bad moments from England's wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow during his side's first Test defeat by Australia in the Ashes.

title: Ex-Brookside actor given suspended prison sentence over crash
description: Ex-Brookside star Louis Emerick admitted careless driving after hitting two girls with his car.

title: Singer Ava Max says stage invader scratched her eye
description: Videos shared online appeared to show a man hit the US pop star in the face while she was performing.

title: Kai Havertz: Arsenal agree £65m deal with Chelsea for German forward
description: Chelsea forward Kai Havertz is set to move to Premier League rivals Arsenal after the two clubs agree on a fee of around £65m.

title: Armed police officers at London hospital after stabbing
description: Armed Metropolitan Police are responding to a stabbing at Central Middlesex Hospital in London.

title: Disney raises concerns over subscription reminder emails
description: New legislation would require the company to remind Disney+ customers of their subscriptions.

title: Could Russia really play nuclear roulette in Ukraine?
description: Steve Rosenberg looks at how discussion of the use of nuclear weapons has crept into Russian media.

title: Champions Cup: Last season's finalists La Rochelle and Leinster to meet in 2023-24 pool stage
description: La Rochelle, the 2023 Champions Cup winners, and Premiership champions Saracens are among the clubs to learn their fate in the 2023-24 pool stage draw

title: Maya civilisation: Archaeologists find ancient city in jungle
description: The remains of the city were found in an ecological reserve in a mostly unexplored area of jungle.

title: Scientist's harrowing experience trapped in submersible at Titanic wreck
description: Michael Guillen relives his near-death experience in a submersible on a dive to the Titanic in 2000.

title: Warning homeowners face 20% drop in disposable income

title: 'We're programmed the same' - England captains Leah Williamson and Heather Knight on their similarities
description: England football and cricket captains Leah Williamson and Heather Knight talk about their teams' strong relationship with both facing huge summers.

title: Warehouse ad showed unhealthily thin model, ASA finds

title: Hampshire man trapped in well after hole opens up in garden

title: Glastonbury Festival officially starts as Emily Eavis opens gates

title: EuroMillions: UK-based ticket holder wins £55m jackpot
description: If it is a single player their win would eclipse the wealth of England and Spurs star Harry Kane.

title: Mateo Kovacic: Manchester City agree £30m deal to sign midfielder from Chelsea
description: Mateo Kovacic is close to joining Premier League champions Manchester City after they agree a deal with Chelsea worth up to £30m.

title: BBC Radio 1: Adele Roberts to leave station after eight years
description: The 44-year-old DJ has spoken openly about her treatment for bowel cancer in the last few years.

title: Faisal Islam: UK inflation shock is really grim
description: Investors are now questioning whether the Bank is in full command over soaring prices.

title: Titan sub: What happens next after sounds detected in search

description: Police searching for Sophie Lambert from Harrogate say a body has been discovered in the River Nidd.

title: Watch: Glastonbury fan gets the giggles live on TV
description: A woman is told she's live on the BBC as she enters the festival site and can't stop laughing.

title: Ukraine war: Zelensky admits slow progress but says offensive is not a movie
description: Weeks into Ukraine's counter-offensive, its leader stresses that the campaign is not a Hollywood movie.

description: Western Storm pace bowler Lauren Filer is set to make her England debut in the Ashes Test against Australia, that starts at Trent Bridge on Thursday.

title: Luton Town fan gets badge tattooed on head for late father

description: Guardians of the Galaxy actor Will Poulter visits his sister in London for Thank a Teacher Day.

title: UK inflation unchanged in May as cost of living remains high
description: Inflation, which is the rate at which prices rise, remained at 8.7% in the year to May, figures show.

title: Thousands welcome summer solstice at Stonehenge
description: Some 10,000 people gather at the ancient site to mark the start of the longest day of the year.

title: Scrapped Covid vaccine deal with Valneva cost UK taxpayers £358m

title: Windrush: Hundreds of people with mental illness sent back to Caribbean
description: Hundreds of the Windrush generation were victims of a "historic injustice" - some torn from their families.

title: WH Smith, M&S and Argos failed to pay minimum wage
description: More than 200 firms face penalties and must repay workers after breaches hit 63,000 people.

title: Horse Hill: Future of UK fossil fuels at stake in test case
description: A Surrey woman challenges the decision to allow four new oil wells on climate change grounds.

title: One in five chance of natural pregnancy after IVF baby

title: US-China tensions: Biden calls Xi a dictator day after Beijing talks
description: The US leader makes the remark just after talks aimed at easing tensions between the countries.

title: Canadian city ready to help in search
description: Coast guard vessels are being sent to the Canadian east coast city, which is 600km from the Titanic wreck.

title: Sharp rise in teenage girls with eating disorders during Covid
description: GP records show largest increases in wealthier areas, as charities say earlier support is needed.

title: Scotland 2-0 Georgia: 'Hell of a lot closer' but Steve Clarke still wary
description: Scotland's win over Georgia moves them "a hell of a lot closer" to qualifying for Euro 2024, says head coach Steve Clarke.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Praying for miracle' and Tory split over mortgages
description: The hunt for the missing Titan submersible and calls for more support for homeowners lead the papers.
